sentence: He's getting a bit cantankerous in his old age.

explanation: formal; to have things or people as parts or members; to consist of
sentence: The course comprises a class book, a practice book, and a CD.

sentence: My tomatoes are flourishing this summer - it must be the warm weather.

explanation: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at
sentence: He looked ludicrous in that suit!

explanation: having very strong opinions that you are not willing to change
sentence: I've never met anyone so arrogant and opinionated.
sentence_gap: I've never met anyone so arrogant and ___________.

explanation: expressing strong opinions very directly without worrying if other people are offended
sentence: Mr Masack is an outspoken critic of the present government.
sentence_gap: Mr Masack is an _________ critic of the present government.

sentence: Posthumous reputations are subject to the vagaries of history.

sentence: The 16-year-old tennis prodigy is the youngest player ever to reach the Olympic finals.

explanation: that has been stated to be true or to have happened, although this may not be the case
sentence: A recent study into the purported health benefits of the drink was not conclusive.
sentence_gap: A recent study into the _________ health benefits of the drink was not conclusive.

explanation: learning something in order to be able to repeat it from memory, rather than in order to understand it
